intro: Symphoricarpos acutus, commonly known as the prickly pear, is a shrub native to North America. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, red berries. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are bell-shaped and usually white or pink. The berries, which are edible when ripe, are an important food source for various wildlife species.
